alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 27 at 11:55PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado, including the following county, Douglas. * WHEN...Until 200 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1155 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Piney Creek, South Platte River, Newlin Gulch, Cherry Creek, Plum Creek, Bayou Gulch, East Plum Creek, Willow Creek, Coal Creek, Big Dry Creek, Kinney Creek and Happy Canyon Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southern Aurora, southwestern Centennial, eastern Highlands Ranch, northeastern Castle Rock, Parker, eastern Littleton, Lone Tree, Castle Pines, The Pinery and Sedalia.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of small creeks and streams, highways and underpasses. Additionally, country roads, farmlands along the banks of creeks, and other low lying areas are subject to flooding.
